ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Instructors were very friendly and passionate to teach students

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: This course was a great way to carry forward the ideas of the intro class into a practical setting. The intro class helped us understand the basics of religious environmental thinking, and this class showed us what Western religions actually do think about and act toward the environment. Professors Tucker and Grim are the best. Class discussions each week were extremely fruitful.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think it was sometimes difficult to understand what was expected of us in our postings. There was a lot of variation in terms of what students delivered. It seemed like this was fine and welcomed, but it was hard to understand what grades on assignments really meant. Comments were extremely helpful! The only other thing is that it's so hard to explain an entire religious tradition and its history in two weeks, and it did feel overwhelming at times.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am interested in religion and how religion is responsible for environment. This course taught me how major world religions view environment as.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: My interest in religion and ecology.
I wanted to continue the learning process that began in the intro class, and I hoped to see how those ideas have worked in the practical context of Western religions.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes, to understand others' religions and their views on the environment
Yes, I gain more insights and understanding of world religions and their diversity of perspectives on the ecology.
Yes! It was a lot of information to take in, but I think I have a much better understanding of the fundamentals of environmental thinking in the Western religions than I did before.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It's an interesting course to learn religion aspects of environment. So I encourage students interested in religion and ecology to take the course
Even if you don't think that a particular religious tradition will be of interest to you, the kinds of ideas discussed in class are applicable in a lot of different ways.
